medical_history.chief_complaint: Epigastric and right upper quadrant abdominal pain with associated nausea and vomiting
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient reports symptoms ongoing for one day. Symptoms of biliary colic had been present for 4 days prior to this episode. Pain described as sharp. No fevers. Normal bowel movement. No dysuria.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension (HTN), Osteoarthritis (OA), Degenerative Joint Disease (DJD), Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD), retinal vein occlusion, colon polyps.
